properties.DESCRIP: This 140-acre county park is located on the Chickahominy River near its confluence with the James River. The park has two outdoor swimming pools, a boat ramp, a fishing pier, camp sites and a small store. It is on the Virginia Capital Trail and close to the Chickahominy Wildlife Management Area. Kayaks, canoes and motor boats are available to rent.
properties.NAME: Chickahominy Riverfront Park Boat Ramp
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: One of the most popular access points in the park, Pony Pasture offers walking trails, access for canoes and kayaks, and space for picnicking and swimming. The large parking lot often becomes full on weekends. Riverside Drive (access from Forest Hill Ave at Hathaway or at Huguenot Bridge)
properties.NAME: Pony Pasture at Longview Drive
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: Just downstream from Pony Pasture, this site features walking trails, wildlife blinds and excellent opportunities to watch birds. There is also a shallow sandy beach with flat water. On-street parking is approximately 0.3 miles from the river. At the end of Landria Dr, near the intersection with Buckhill Rd
properties.NAME: The Wetlands at Landria Drive
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This popular site offers a canoe launch that serves as the terminus of many urban paddling or tubing trips. This is also the location of the park system headquarters and nature center where parking is available. Just off Riverside Dr, across from Hillcrest Rd
properties.NAME: Reedy Creek
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This site, which is solely for launching and landing non-motorized boats, offers limited parking, a changing room and a portable toilet
properties.NAME: North Shore at 14th Street
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This park area on the south bank of the James runs along Richmond’s flood wall, which was built to keep rising river waters from flooding the lowest parts of the City. Stairs leading to the top of the wall provide beautiful views of the river and city skyline. From this park, the walk connects along the top of the flood wall to the west and along the riverbank to the east. The river is accessible from the north side of the wall.
properties.NAME: Floodwall Walk at Mayo Bridge
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This 22-acre park overlooks Swift Creek with a DGIF-maintained pier for fishing and a concrete ramp for motorized and non-motorized boats.
properties.NAME: White Bank Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This publicly-owned marina has slips and ramps for motorized boats and nonmotorized boats, as well as a separate fishing pier, an overlook and picnic tables. A daily launch fee is required, but seasonal passes are also available
properties.NAME: Hopewell Marina
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: 2013 Best Resort Marina by Chesapeake Bay Mag
properties.NAME: Smithfield Station Marina
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This small park with a big view is a popular spot for launching canoes and kayaks into the Appomattox River. The shallow bay is ideal for paddling day trips.
properties.NAME: Hopewell City Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This public landing provides access to the Chickahominy River from Morris Creek. Situated in the Chickahominy Wildlife Management Area and managed by DGIF, the public boat ramp and dock offer boating and fishing access to the creek and river. Hiking, hunting and wildlife viewing opportunities are available in the area.  Appx 1 mile north of VA Rte 5 on Morris Creek Landing Rd
properties.NAME: Chickahominy Wildlife Management Area Morris Creek Boat Ramp
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This public landing provides access to the Chickahominy River from Morris Creek. Situated in the Chickahominy Wildlife Management Area and managed by DGIF, the public boat ramp and dock offer boating and fishing access to the creek and river. Hiking, hunting and wildlife viewing opportunities are available in the area.  Appx 1 mile north of VA Rte 5 on Morris Creek Landing Rd
properties.NAME: Chickahominy Wildlife Management Area Canoe/Kayak Access Point
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This publicly-owned site in James City County offers a ramp for launching motorized boats, canoes and kayaks. The facility has a scenic area for fishing and wildlife viewing. Parking is available on site. Appx. 5.5 miles south of US Rte 60 on Brickyard Rd / SR 610
properties.NAME: James City County’s Brickyard Landing Boat Ramp
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: A privately-owned fishing and boating facility on the banks of the Chickahominy River. This location offers fishing, boating and canoeing opportunities and includes a dock, boat slips and a convenience store.
properties.NAME: Chickahominy Haven Boat Ramp
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: Formerly Hideaway Boat Landing, River’s Rest is located on the banks of the Chickahominy River. This commercial facility offers fishing, birding, boating and hunting. Amenities include motel accommodations, a restaurant, pool, picnic area and a store for fishing tackle, gas, drinks and boating supplies.
properties.NAME: River’s Rest Marina Boat Ramp
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: Restaurant on site, ask for permission
properties.DESCRIP: This privately-owned marina features a boat ramp with docking facilities, a marine store with boating and fishing supplies and the Colonial Harbor Restaurant. The marina offers both short and long hauling of a wide variety of boats, a travel lift for vessels up to 8 tons, boat servicing, and wet and dry storage.
properties.NAME: Colonial Harbor Boat Ramp
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This privately-owned campground and boating facility on the Chickahominy River in Lanexa offers RV and tent camping, overnight cottages and picnic areas. The boating facility provides swimming, fishing, boating and canoeing access to the river. A camp store and bait and tackle shop are located on site.
properties.NAME: Riverside Campground Boat Ramp
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This privately-owned RV park and marina in Lanexa offers fishing, boating, canoeing and swimming opportunities on the Chickahominy River. Amenities include Walkers Dam Grill, Rocks River Roadhouse Tavern, full-service boat slips, boat rentals, a convenience store and a bait and tackle shop.
properties.NAME: Rockahock Campground Boat Ramp
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: DGIF Jackson River Fishing Public Map
properties.NAME: Water Plant
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: DGIF Boating Access Sites (as of June 2011)

properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: DGIF Boating Access Sites (as of June 2011)
properties.NAME: Low Moor
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: Mud bank at east edge of Riverview Park on Chesapeake Street in Charlottesville
properties.NAME: Riverview Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: VA Dept. of Game and Inland Fisheries public boat access on VA Route 690 across the James River from Columbia
properties.NAME: Columbia
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This protected area surrounding Henricus Historical Park provides 810 acres of diverse woods, wetlands and wildlife. Bordered by the James River, the area includes a great blue heron rookery, a boat landing, and a 4.5-mile multi-use trail that circumnavigates the tidal lagoon. A map of the lagoon water trail, which is accessible to canoes and kayaks, can be downloaded from the Chesterfield County website. The area shares a parking lot with Henricus Historical Park. From Jefferson Davis Hwy take Osborne Rd to Coxendale Rd
properties.NAME: Dutch Gap Conservation Area
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: Boat ramp on other side of park
properties.DESCRIP: See Hyperlink
properties.NAME: Chickahominy Riverfront Park Pier
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This 24-acre park, with its great opportunities for fishing, bird watching and picnicking, provides the only public access to the northern bank of the James River within 36 miles. Amenities include a picnic area, rest rooms, a fishing pier and a short swamp boardwalk leading to a wooded trail. The park has separate entrances for the upper and lower levels. Just south of VA Rte 5 on Wilcox Wharf Rd
properties.NAME: Lawrence Lewis Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This public-access site is located within the Chickahominy Wildlife Management Area and is managed by DGIF. Although this site provides direct access to the Chickahominy River, the public boat landing is not paved, giving it the nickname of “Mud Landing.” Hiking, hunting and wildlife viewing opportunities are available in the area.
properties.NAME: Chickahominy WMA / Morris Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This site, jointly maintained by DGIF and the County of Henrico, includes a short pier for fishing, picnic tables, rest rooms, and a concrete ramp for launching and landing motorized and non-motorized boats. From Rte 5 take Kingsland Rd south to Deep Bottom Rd
properties.NAME: Deep Bottom Park & Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This 26-acre park includes multiple boat ramps and docks, as well as a fishing pier maintained by DGIF. Other amenities include a covered gathering pavilion, rest rooms, benches, swings and almost a mile of paved walking trails through the woods. Intersection of Kingsland Rd and Osborne Tnpk
properties.NAME: Osborne Pike Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: Black Vultures are a nuscance in the area
properties.DESCRIP: This site near Henricus Historical Park, provides access
properties.NAME: Dutch Gap Boat Launch
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This 32-acre park, built on the site of the second permanent English settlement in the New World, boasts a replica of the Citie of Henricus circa 1611. In addition to exploring the village, visitors can enjoy the spectacular views of the river from an observation deck on the bluff. There is no direct river access at this site.
properties.NAME: Henricus Historical Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: The historic locks at this park mark the terminus of Richmond’s once-thriving canal system. Cross the locks to access a sandy beach on Chapel Island next to the ruins of the former Trigg Shipyard where steam torpedo boats were built. The park is also the trailhead of Richmond’s first segment of the Virginia Capital Trail, an off-road greenway which will eventually extend all the way to Williamsburg. Located near Dock and Pear Streets.
properties.NAME: Great Shiplock Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This trailhead of the Richmond Slave Trail is also a popular fishing spot, especially when the shad run. The site offers a concrete ramp for motorized and non-motorized boats and is jointly maintained by JRPS and DGIF. (jamesriverpark.org) Located at the end of Brander St, off Maury St, beyond the flood wall.
properties.NAME: Ancarrow's Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This beautiful park with expansive views of the confluence of the Appomattox and the James Rivers offers a walking trail, a boardwalk, benches, picnic tables, a gazebo and rest rooms. This popular fishing spot is adjacent to the Eppes Plantation, in the oldest part of Hopewell.
properties.NAME: City Point Park - PNBP
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: The Sailing Center offers boating courses for adults and children and offers a Spring, Summer, and Fall Regatta Series for those interested in racing. Please contact us for more information. (757)-444-2918
properties.NAME: Norfolk Naval Base Marina
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: CNU Sailing Center Located Here
properties.NAME: Menchville Marine
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This DGIF-maintained site at the Old Columbia Road bridge offers a concrete ramp that is strictly for launching and landing motorized and non-motorized boats. Parking is only for vehicles associated with boaters. Appx. a quarter mile south of River Road West / VA 6 on the south bank
properties.NAME: Columbia
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This DGIF-maintained site at the Cartersville Road bridge offers a concrete ramp that is strictly for launching and landing motorized and non-motorized boats. Parking is only for vehicles associated with boaters.From River Road West / VA 6 go south on Cartersville Rd / Rte 45 to the south bank
properties.NAME: Cartersville Boat Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This DGIF-owned and -maintained site offers a concrete ramp that is strictly for launching and landing motorized and non-motorized boats. The site is surrounded by Westview on the James property. Parking is only for vehicles associated with boaters. Appx. 5 miles south of River Road West / VA 6 on Westview Rd / SR 643
properties.NAME: Westview Boat Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This DGIF-maintained site near the Maidens Rd / Rte 522 bridge is strictly for launching and landing motorized and non-motorized boats via a concrete ramp. Parking is only for vehicles associated with boaters. Appx. half a mile south of River Road West / VA 6 on Maidens Rd
properties.NAME: Maidens Boat Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This DGIF-maintained site is strictly for launching and landing motorized and non-motorized boats via a concrete ramp. Parking is only for vehicles associated with boaters. Appx. 1 mile north of Huguenot Trail / SR 711 on Watkins Landing Rd / SR 652
properties.NAME: Watkins Boat Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This expansive and well-maintained, family-friendly park is jointly maintained by Chesterfield County and DGIF. Amenities include non-motorized boat access, a fishing pier, hiking trails, volleyball courts and a picnic area that includes tables, grill and rest rooms. Appx. 1/2 mile north of Robious Rd / VA 711 on James River Rd
properties.NAME: Robious Boat Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This western-most portion of the park system is a popular canoe and kayak launching site where the water is flat and deep. The site is jointly maintained by the City of Richmond and DGIF. Located off Riverside Drive just west of the Huguenot Bridge
properties.NAME: Huguenot Flatwater Canoe Landing
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This small, sandy beach with a great view of the river is between the former Tredegar Iron Works and the popular event venue at Brown’s Island. This popular site frequently becomes crowded on weekends.
properties.NAME: Tredegar Boat Ramp / Brown's Island
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This 176-acre park features several athletic facilities and a diverse natural area. Athletic and picnic areas are concentrated in the upper areas of the park, and access to the lower areas is provided by a system of trails including a floating boardwalk through a freshwater tidal marsh.
properties.NAME: Point of Rocks Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This dammed portion of the Appomattox River doesn’t connect with the free-flowing river below, but it has a large fishing pier in addition to a concrete boat ramp for launching and landing motorized and non-motorized boats. Parking at this DGIF-maintained site is for boaters and fishermen only
properties.NAME: Lake Chesdin Landing South

properties.DESCRIP: The Route 654 to James River stretch is one of many paddling stretches in this river system.  You might have to settle for a hotel a bit away from the river if you want to stay the night, but do book a room before you come because it is a very popular destination. Some people prefer whitewater rafting and some kayaking, either way this area has a large number of paddling places. The put-in location is a reasonable drive from Charlottesville, please print out a copy of the road map further down the page so you won’t get lost. This stretch has has enough mileage, it's good length for a morning trip. For all you camping people there are campgrounds nearby. The wonderful -blank- County scenery and the sparkling of the sunlight on the water beats anything. Getting some good exercise and a chance to spend some time outdoors are sure to keep you coming back for more.
properties.NAME: Falling Rock Bridge - Tye River
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: Tough put in location, under the bridge.
properties.DESCRIP: Class II-IV rapids depending on water level. See comments on hyperlink. Take out at Boiling Springs is on private property. Remember to ask for permission before putting in at Potts Creek Road.
properties.NAME: Potts Creek Road
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: Narrow pull-off area on Polo Grounds Road,
properties.DESCRIP: Short unmarked path leads from Polo Grounds Road to the North side of the river near the base of the Rivanna Reservoir dam. Access Polo Grounds Road from US 29 North just past the Rivanna River bridge. A few mild class 2 rapids -- takeout at Darden Tow Park.
properties.NAME: Polo Grounds Road
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: Formally Tucker Park at Maiden’s Crossing, this park is a great place to get out and enjoy the river and the outdoors. There is a trail loop, and a river access ramp is planned. Appx. 1/4 mile south of River Road West / VA 6 on Maidens Rd / SR 522
properties.NAME: Tuckers Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This well-known site for exploring, swimming, fishing and picnicking requires visitors to rock hop over several small islands to access the river. Shoes with good traction are recommended. The access road stretching from the Boulevard Bridge to Belle Isle passes nearby. The parking lot is often closed, but on-street parking is available. Located off Riverside Drive, north of Forest Hill Park
properties.NAME: 43rd Street
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This popular summertime
properties.NAME: North Bank Park
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This spot offers pedestrian and bicycle access to the south side of Belle Isle via a service bridge. The parking lot is often closed, but on-street parking is available. Just off Riverside Dr, across from 22nd St
properties.NAME: 22nd Street
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: Arguably Richmond’s best-known access point to the James River, Belle Isle features many recreational opportunities. Walking and biking trails circle the island, passing crumbling structures from its past uses as a nail factory, Civil War prison, quarry and hydroelectric power plant. Features include interpreted historical sites, wheelchair-accessible fishing at the quarry pond and a granite wall for rock climbing. The island is accessible from the north side via a pedestrian bridge suspended beneath the Lee Bridge
properties.NAME: Belle Isle
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: Access road closed from Dusk until Dawn
properties.DESCRIP: This site offers a good launching point for canoes and kayaks, as well as fishing, picnicking and hiking along the 1.5 miles of trails. It is located in the Radcliffe Appomattox River Conservation Area, just below the Lake Chesdin dam and across from the lake’s boat launch. Plenty of parking is available, but the road is closed dusk to dawn
properties.NAME: Appomattox River Canoe Launch
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: Within walking distance of Old Towne Petersburg and Virginia State University, this pleasant, well-kept park has ample room to relax by the river, as well as access to the Appomattox River Heritage Trail. Off Grove Ave, near Old Town Petersburg
properties.NAME: Squaw Alley
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.DESCRIP: This public, non-motorized boat access area connects to the Appomattox River Heritage Trail. Off Rolfe St, near Old Town Petersburg
properties.NAME: Pocahontas Island
properties.Creator: fbiasi

properties.Notes: Canoe access site; camping available and food
